title: Eliminates the requirement for the use of electronic voting machines during village, special district, library district and fire district elections
summary: Eliminates the requirement for the use of electronic voting machines during village, special district, improvement district, library district and fire district elections and authorizes the use of mechanical lever voting machines or paper ballots during such elections; establishes certain requirements for paper ballots.

       Introduced by M. of A. SCHIMEL, LATIMER -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Election Law

       AN  ACT  to  amend the election law, in relation to authorizing village,
         special district, improvement district and library district  elections
         to  be conducted on mechanical lever voting machines or paper ballots;
         and to amend the town law, in  relation  to  authorizing  the  use  of
         mechanical  lever  voting  machines  or paper ballots at fire district
         elections

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The election law is amended by adding a new section 7-132
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  7-132.  PAPER  BALLOTS;  VILLAGE,  SPECIAL  DISTRICT,   IMPROVEMENT
    4  DISTRICT,  LIBRARY  DISTRICT  AND  FIRE  DISTRICT  ELECTIONS. 1. FOR ANY
    5  VILLAGE, SPECIAL DISTRICT, IMPROVEMENT  DISTRICT,  LIBRARY  DISTRICT  OR
    6  FIRE  DISTRICT  CONDUCTING  AN ELECTION IN WHICH PAPER BALLOTS ARE TO BE
    7  COUNTED BY HAND, THE FORMAT OF SUCH PAPER BALLOTS SHALL CONFORM  TO  THE
    8  PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
    9    2.  ALL  PAPER  BALLOTS  SHALL BE PRINTED ON PAPER OF A QUALITY, SIZE,
   10  COLOR AND WEIGHT AS SHALL BE DETERMINED BY THE STATE BOARD OF  ELECTIONS
   11  ON OR BEFORE JULY SEVENTH, TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN.
   12    3.  ALL PAPER BALLOTS OF THE SAME KIND AT THE SAME POLLING PLACE SHALL
   13  BE IDENTICAL IN APPEARANCE AND FORM.  A  DIFFERENT,  BUT  IN  EACH  CASE
   14  UNIFORM  STYLE  AND  SIZE OF TYPE, SHALL BE USED FOR THE PRINTING OF THE
   15  NAMES OF CANDIDATES, THE TITLES OF OFFICES,  POLITICAL  DESIGNATION  AND
   16  THE  READING FORM OF ALL PROPOSALS AND QUESTIONS PRESENTED. THE NAMES OF
   17  ALL CANDIDATES SHALL BE PRINTED IN UPPER-CASE  LETTERS,  IN  BLACK-FACED
   18  TYPE.
   19    4.  EACH PAPER BALLOT SHALL BE PRINTED ON A SINGLE SHEET OF PAPER WITH
   20  A DETACHABLE STUB WHICH MAY BE SEPARATED THEREFROM  ALONG  A  PERFORATED
   21  HORIZONTAL LINE ACROSS THE ENTIRE BALLOT. ON THE FACE OF SUCH STUB SHALL

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04799-03-1

       A. 3093                             2

    1  BE PRINTED THE INSTRUCTIONS TO THE VOTER, AND ON THE BACK THEREOF, IMME-
    2  DIATELY  ABOVE  THE CENTER OF THE ENDORSEMENT ON THE REAR OF THE BALLOT,
    3  SHALL BE PRINTED "#" WITH THE BLANK  SPACE  FILLED  IN  BY  AN  ELECTION
    4  INSPECTOR  WITH  THE  CONSECUTIVE NUMBER OF BALLOTS CAST AT THE ELECTION
    5  BEGINNING WITH #1, AND INCREASING IN REGULAR NUMERICAL ORDER.
    6    5. ON THE REAR OF THE BALLOT, BELOW THE LINE OF PERFORATIONS, JUST  TO
    7  THE  RIGHT  OF  CENTER  AND  APPEARING ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BALLOT WHEN
    8  FOLDED, AND ALSO ON THE FRONT OF THE BALLOT, DIRECTLY BELOW THE LINE  OF
    9  PERFORATIONS, SHALL BE PRINTED THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
   10    "OFFICIAL BALLOT FOR (VILLAGE, SPECIAL DISTRICT, IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT,
   11  LIBRARY DISTRICT OR FIRE DISTRICT) OFFICERS AND PROPOSITIONS
   12    (THE DATE OF THE ELECTION)
   13    (A  FACSIMILE  SIGNATURE  OF  THE  OFFICER  OR OFFICERS PROVIDING SUCH
   14  BALLOT)".
   15    6. ON THE TOP OF THE DETACHABLE STUB OR ON THE EDGE OF THE BALLOT, THE
   16  FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS SHALL BE PRINTED IN HEAVY BLACK TYPE:
   17                                "INSTRUCTIONS
   18    (A) MARK ONLY WITH A PEN HAVING BLUE OR BLACK INK  OR  WITH  A  PENCIL
   19  HAVING BLACK LEAD.
   20    (B)  TO VOTE FOR A CANDIDATE WHOSE NAME IS PRINTED ON THIS BALLOT MAKE
   21  A SINGLE CROSS X MARK OR A CHECK V MARK IN ONE OF  THE  SQUARES  TO  THE
   22  RIGHT OF AN EMBLEM OPPOSITE HIS OR HER NAME.
   23    (C)  TO  VOTE  FOR  A  PERSON WHOSE NAME IS NOT PRINTED ON THIS BALLOT
   24  WRITE OR STAMP HIS OR HER NAME ON A BLANK LINE UNDER THE  NAMES  OF  THE
   25  CANDIDATES FOR THAT OFFICE.
   26    (D)  TO  VOTE YES OR NO ON A PROPOSAL MAKE A SINGLE X OR V MARK IN THE
   27  SQUARE OPPOSITE YOUR VOTE.
   28    (E) ANY OTHER MARK OR WRITING, OR ANY  ERASURE  MADE  ON  THIS  BALLOT
   29  OUTSIDE THE VOTING SQUARES OR BLANK SPACES PROVIDED FOR VOTING WILL VOID
   30  THIS ENTIRE BALLOT.
   31    (F) DO NOT OVERVOTE. IF YOU SELECT A GREATER NUMBER OF CANDIDATES THAN
   32  THERE  ARE  VACANCIES  TO  BE  FILLED, YOUR BALLOT WILL BE VOID FOR THAT
   33  PUBLIC OFFICE OR PARTY POSITION.
   34    (G) IF YOU TEAR, DEFACE OR WRONGLY MARK THIS  BALLOT,  RETURN  IT  AND
   35  OBTAIN  ANOTHER.  DO  NOT  ATTEMPT  TO CORRECT MISTAKES ON THE BALLOT BY
   36  MAKING ERASURES OR CROSS OUTS. ERASURES OR CROSS OUTS MAY INVALIDATE ALL
   37  OR PART OF YOUR BALLOT. PRIOR TO SUBMITTING YOUR BALLOT, IF YOU  MAKE  A
   38  MISTAKE  IN COMPLETING THE BALLOT OR WISH TO CHANGE YOUR BALLOT CHOICES,
   39  YOU MAY OBTAIN AND COMPLETE A NEW BALLOT. YOU HAVE A RIGHT TO A REPLACE-
   40  MENT BALLOT UPON RETURN OF THE ORIGINAL BALLOT."
   41    7. EACH BALLOT SHALL BE PRINTED IN SECTIONS IN WHICH  THE  CANDIDATES'
   42  NAMES,  EMBLEMS  AND  POLITICAL  DESIGNATIONS,  THE BALLOT PROPOSALS AND
   43  OTHER REQUISITE MATTER SHALL EACH BE BOXED IN BY HEAVY BLACK LINES.
   44    ON THE BALLOT SHALL BE VOTING SQUARES IN WHICH VOTERS MAY  MAKE  THEIR
   45  VOTING  MARKS. ALL VOTING SQUARES SHALL BE BOUNDED BY HEAVY BLACK LINES,
   46  THE PERPENDICULAR LINES TO BE NOT LESS THAN ONE-SIXTEENTH  OF  ONE  INCH
   47  WIDE.    THE  VOTING SQUARES AND THE SPACES OCCUPIED BY THE EMBLEM SHALL
   48  HAVE A DEPTH AND WIDTH OF FIVE-SIXTEENTHS OF ONE INCH. NO VOTING  SQUARE
   49  SHALL  BE  PROVIDED IN FRONT OF THE BLANK SPACES PROVIDED FOR A VOTER TO
   50  WRITE IN A NAME.
   51    8. THE SPACE FOR THE TITLE OF AN OFFICE SHALL BE THREE-EIGHTHS OF  ONE
   52  INCH,  AND  THE NAME OF A CANDIDATE OR FOR WRITING IN A NAME, ONE-FOURTH
   53  OF ONE INCH, IN DEPTH. AT THE LEFT OF THE NAME OF EACH DESIGNATED CANDI-
   54  DATE SHALL BE AN ENCLOSED VOTING SPACE, THREE-EIGHTHS  OF  ONE  INCH  IN
   55  WIDTH  AND APPROXIMATELY ONE-FOURTH OF ONE INCH IN DEPTH, BOUNDED ABOVE,
   56  BELOW AND TO THE RIGHT BY BLACK LINES, HEAVIER THAN THOSE WHICH SEPARATE

       A. 3093                             3

    1  THE SPACES CONTAINING THE NAMES OF CANDIDATES. TO  THE  LEFT  OF  VOTING
    2  SPACES  WHICH  DO  NOT  ADJOIN A VERTICAL LINE DIVIDING TWO PARTS, THERE
    3  SHALL BE A HEAVY BLACK VERTICAL LINE  APPROXIMATELY  ONE-EIGHTH  OF  ONE
    4  INCH  IN WIDTH. NO VOTING SPACE SHALL BE PROVIDED IN THE SPACE FOR WRIT-
    5  ING IN NAMES. IN SUCH CASE, THE SPACE CORRESPONDING TO  A  VOTING  SPACE
    6  SHALL BE ALL BLACK.
    7    9. BELOW THE NAMES OF THE CANDIDATES FOR EACH OFFICE OR POSITION THERE
    8  SHALL  BE  PRINTED AS MANY BLANK SPACES, FOR WRITING IN NAMES OF PERSONS
    9  FOR WHOM THE VOTER DESIRES TO VOTE, AS THERE ARE PERSONS TO BE NOMINATED
   10  OR ELECTED.
   11    10. IN CASE THE SECTIONS SHALL BE SO NUMEROUS AS TO  MAKE  THE  BALLOT
   12  UNWIELDY  IF  THEY  ARE PRINTED IN ONE COLUMN, THEY MAY BE PRINTED IN AS
   13  MANY COLUMNS AS SHALL BE NECESSARY,  AND  IN  THAT  CASE,  IN  ORDER  TO
   14  PRODUCE A RECTANGULAR BALLOT, BLANK SECTIONS MAY BE USED.
   15    11. THE NAMES OF PARTIES OR INDEPENDENT BODIES WHICH CONTAIN MORE THAN
   16  FIFTEEN LETTERS MAY, WHENEVER LIMITATIONS OF SPACE SO REQUIRE, BE PRINT-
   17  ED ON THE BALLOT IN AN ABBREVIATED FORM. IN PRINTING THE NAMES OF CANDI-
   18  DATES  WHOSE  FULL  NAMES  CONTAIN  MORE  THAN FIFTEEN LETTERS, ONLY THE
   19  SURNAME MUST BE PRINTED IN FULL. THE OFFICER OR BOARD CHARGED  WITH  THE
   20  DUTY OF PREPARING THE BALLOTS SHALL REQUEST EACH SUCH CANDIDATE TO INDI-
   21  CATE,   IN  WRITING,  THE  SHORTENED  FORM  IN  WHICH,  SUBJECT  TO  THE
   22  RESTRICTION, HIS NAME  SHALL  BE  PRINTED.  IF  NO  SUCH  INDICATION  IS
   23  RECEIVED  FROM  SUCH CANDIDATE WITHIN THE TIME SPECIFIED IN THE REQUEST,
   24  SUCH OFFICER OR BOARD SHALL MAKE THE NECESSARY DETERMINATION. NO  EMBLEM
   25  SHALL  OCCUPY  A SPACE LONGER IN ANY DIRECTION THAN THE VOTING SQUARE TO
   26  WHICH IT RELATES.
   27    S 2. Subdivision 1 of section 7-200 of the election law, as amended by
   28  chapter 181 of the laws of 2005, is amended to read as follows:
   29    1. The board of elections of the city of New  York  and  other  county
   30  boards  of  elections  may  adopt  any  kind of voting machine or system
   31  approved by the state board of elections, or the use of which  has  been
   32  specifically  authorized  by  law;  and thereupon such voting machine or
   33  system may be used at any or all elections and  shall  be  used  at  all
   34  general  or  special elections held by such boards in such city, town or
   35  village and in every contested primary election in the city of New  York
   36  and  in every contested primary election outside the city of New York in
   37  which there are one thousand or more enrolled voters qualified to  vote;
   38  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER, THAT SUCH MACHINES AND SYSTEMS SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED
   39  TO BE USED IN ANY VILLAGE, SPECIAL  DISTRICT,  IMPROVEMENT  DISTRICT  OR
   40  LIBRARY  DISTRICT  ELECTION  AND  THE  USE  OF  MECHANICAL  LEVER VOTING
   41  MACHINES SHALL BE AUTHORIZED FOR VILLAGE ELECTIONS.   No more  than  two
   42  types  of  voting  machines or systems may be used by any local board of
   43  elections at a single election. Notwithstanding the other provisions  of
   44  this  subdivision,  any local board of elections may borrow or lease for
   45  use on an experimental basis for a period of  not  more  than  one  year
   46  each, voting machines or systems of any type approved by the state board
   47  of elections.
   48    S 3. Subdivision 1 of section 7-203 of the election law, as amended by
   49  chapter 180 of the laws of 2005, is amended to read as follows:
   50    1.  The board of elections shall provide a sufficient number of voting
   51  machines to fully equip all election districts within its  jurisdiction.
   52  Such  voting  machines shall be used at all general, special and primary
   53  elections conducted pursuant to this chapter;  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT
   54  THE  USE  OF  SUCH VOTING MACHINES SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED DURING VILLAGE,
   55  SPECIAL DISTRICT, IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT OR LIBRARY DISTRICT ELECTIONS AND

       A. 3093                             4

    1  THE USE OF MECHANICAL LEVER VOTING MACHINES OR PAPER  BALLOTS  SHALL  BE
    2  AUTHORIZED AT SUCH ELECTIONS.
    3    S  4. Subdivision 29 of section 176 of the town law, as added by chap-
    4  ter 568 of the laws of 1949, is amended to read as follows:
    5    29. May authorize the use of voting machines at any annual or  special
    6  election  held within the fire district and such voting machine shall be
    7  used in accordance with the provisions contained in article nine of  the
    8  election  law,  PROVIDED  THAT  NO  PROVISION  OF LAW SHALL BE DEEMED TO
    9  PROHIBIT THE USE OF MECHANICAL LEVER VOTING MACHINES OR PAPER BALLOTS AT
   10  ANY SUCH ELECTION.
   11    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately.
